alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, northeastern Madison, Moore, eastern Lincoln and Franklin Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty outflow winds associated with thunderstorms in middle Tennessee. The line of strong and gusty winds will precede any rainfall, but could still cause minor damage. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Cowan, Huntland, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Anderson and Hytop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Tims Ford Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Gusty winds are likely, and lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
